transportAdvice: Verona's historic center is compact and highly walkable, with most major attractions reachable on foot; the city also has a local bus network that connects the center to outlying areas and the train station. Taxis are available at designated stands near the station and main squares, and are a practical option for reaching the airport or areas beyond the historic core.

weather.description: Cold and often foggy winter days with occasional frost; tourist crowds are minimal and the city feels quietly atmospheric.
Still cold but days begin to lengthen slightly; occasional sunny spells break up the grey winter weather.
Early spring brings milder temperatures and more sunshine, though showers are common and evenings remain cool.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming gardens; rain showers are frequent but generally short-lived.
Warm and increasingly sunny with occasional thunderstorms; a lovely time to explore the city and surrounding countryside.
Warm summer conditions set in with long sunny days; the famous opera season at the Arena di Verona begins.
Hot and mostly dry with peak tourist season in full swing; evenings are warm and ideal for outdoor dining.
Consistently hot with intense afternoon sun; the Arena opera season continues and the city is busy with visitors.
Comfortable early autumn temperatures with fewer crowds; occasional thunderstorms can bring brief heavy rain.
Mild and often golden autumn days with increasing cloud cover; a quieter and very pleasant time to visit.
Cool and frequently rainy with fog returning to the Po Valley; the city takes on a moody, off-season character.
Cold winter weather with festive Christmas markets in the historic center; occasional frost and fog are common.
